title: Royal Portrush might be the only thing that can stop Scottie Scheffler at The Open
content: Over the second round, Scheffler did what he has done many times: made victory feel inevitable. But could this one be the toughest to hold on to?

title: Safely into weekend, Rory eyes big Open chase
content: Rory McIlroy carded a 2-under 69 in the second round of The Open to give him back-to-back under-par rounds.

title: Ionescu, fueled by loss to Curry, wins 3-point title
content: Sabrina Ionescu captured her second WNBA 3-point contest crown and called it redemption after losing to Stephen Curry in their 2024 shootout.

title: Acuña stuns Yanks with 301-foot outfield assist
content: Ronald Acuña Jr. caught the Yankees off-guard with a spectacular throw to end the third inning in the Braves' series-opening 7-3 victory.

title: Judge dismisses Pryor-led OSU lawsuit vs. NCAA
content: An Ohio judge ruled that former Ohio State quarterback Terrelle Pryor filed his proposed class action against the NCAA, Ohio State and others too late.

title: Ex-NFLPA boss' strip club expenses face scrutiny
content: Former NFL Players Association leader Lloyd Howell Jr. resigned after an outside investigator hired by the union received documents this week showing he charged the union for two visits to strip clubs.

title: Docs: Bettor placed 30 wagers on Rozier unders
content: A professional bettor placed 30 wagers in 46 minutes, all involving Terry Rozier in a 2023 NBA game, according to documents obtained by ESPN that reveal new details about the suspicious betting under scrutiny by federal investigators.

title: Police: Noose found at Titans' new stadium site
content: A noose was found at the site of the Titans' new Nissan Stadium, according to the Metropolitan Nashville Police Department, with work stopped at the site amid an investigation.

title: Attorney: Lawsuit alleging rape by Sharpe settled
content: A lawyer says NFL Hall of Fame member Shannon Sharpe has resolved a lawsuit that accused him of sexually assaulting a woman during their relationship.

title: Crowe gives Tigers highest-rated recruit since MPJ
content: Jason Crowe Jr., considered the No. 1 point guard in the 2026 class, announced his commitment to Missouri on Friday, becoming the Tigers' highest-ranked recruit in almost a decade.

title: ❤️ Paige Bueckers calls Azzi Fudd her girlfriend
content: The Dallas Wings rookie referred to the UConn Huskies guard as her girlfriend during WNBA All-Star Weekend.

title: WNBA All-Star grades: Liberty's Ionescu, Cloud sweep 3-point, skills challenge crowns
content: Natasha Cloud won the WNBA All-Star skills challenge. Sabrina Ionescu won the 3-point contest. We grade every competitor.

title: Five overreactions before 2025 NFL season: Commanders win NFC East? Chiefs lose AFC West?
content: Is the Bucs QB destined for a massive new contract? Will the Commanders own the NFC East? We're judging offseason overreactions.

title: Big Ten preview: Can Penn State finally break through? Will Ohio State repeat?
content: As the Big Ten looks to produce its third straight national champion, Bill Connelly breaks down all 18 teams.

title: It's time for the second half! Preview, rankings, playoff odds for all 30 MLB teams
content: Who will rule the rest of the season? Here's everything you need to know coming out of the All-Star break.

title: NBA summer league standouts: Flagg, Harper, Hansen and surprise stars
content: From Cooper Flagg to veteran players, Kevin Pelton hands out superlatives for 2025 NBA summer league.

title: Timeline: Caitlin Clark's injury-riddled first half of the WNBA season
content: Three separate injuries have sidelined the Indiana point guard and All-Star for 10 regular-season WNBA games.

title: 14 players who could be picked No. 1 in the 2026 NFL draft
content: Which quarterback could go first overall? What about edge rusher T.J. Parker or another non-QB? Let's project the race.

title: 'We couldn't chance it': Why the Suns and Bradley Beal finally came to terms
content: One element of the Suns' roster failure has loomed: How to end their marriage to the three-time All-Star.

title: The USMNT's to-do list before the 2026 World Cup, ranked by urgency
content: The USMNT's failure at the Gold Cup makes it clear changes are needed before the 2026 World Cup. Here are the five keys, ranked by urgency.

title: Weah to Marseille, Reyna to anywhere but Dortmund? Best transfer fits for USMNT stars
content: What moves, if any, should these eight USMNT players make to ensure they'll be in top form next summer?

title: Sources: Man Utd, Brentford agree Mbeumo deal
content: Manchester United are set to complete the signing of Bryan Mbeumo after agreeing a deal in excess of £70 million ($94m) with Brentford, sources have told ESPN.

title: Spain reach semifinals despite missing 2 penalties
content: Spain overcame missing two penalties to beat hosts Switzerland 2-0 on Friday to reach the Women's Euro semifinals for just the second time.

title: Madueke joins Arsenal from rivals Chelsea
content: Arsenal have completed the signing of Noni Madueke from London rivals Chelsea, the clubs confirmed Friday.

title: Copa warm-up rules changed after Marta criticism
content: CONMEBOL said it has adjusted pre-match procedures at the Copa América Femenina, following criticism from Brazilian players and coaching staff.

title: Wrexham sign New Zealand's Cacace from Empoli
content: Wrexham continued preparations for their latest promotion push with the signing of New Zealand international defender Liberato Cacace from Empoli.

title: Zlatan sends Holmberg support after penalty miss
content: Zlatan Ibrahimovic offered some words of support to Smilla Holmberg after her miss in Thursday's penalty shootout ended Sweden's Euro 2025 campaign.

title: Swiss hail Euros as 'take-off' moment despite exit
content: Switzerland coach Pia Sundhage hopes their run to the quarterfinals of their home Women's Euro will be a take-off moment for women's football in the country.

title: Masche on Messi, All-Stars: 'Would prefer rest'
content: Inter Miami head coach Javier Mascherano said he would prefer that Lionel Messi and Jordi Alba not participate in the 2025 MLS All-Star Game, insisting players should be resting amid the ongoing regular season.

title: Spain win first Euros knockout game, but still have work to do after beating Swiss
content: Spain's Euro journey will continue after defeating hosts Switzerland, though they have little time to dwell on winning their first knockout game at this tournament. After all, there's more history to make.

title: What it's like boxing Pacquiao, and how he can beat Barrios
content: Timothy Bradley Jr. shares his thoughts about fighting Manny Pacquiao and breaks down Saturday's fight.

title: AFC North intrigue: Will Ravens be first to three-peat? Will Rodgers snap Tomlin's playoff skid?
content: The AFC North is loaded with intrigue and talent, from Lamar Jackson to Joe Burrow and now Aaron Rodgers. Here's what to know.

title: Chiefs QB Patrick Mahomes ready to enter new era: Turning 30
content: Mahomes has won two MVPs and three Super Bowls in his 20s. He'll turn 30 as he starts his ninth NFL season.

title: Assembling the 2028 Olympic roster for U.S. flag football: Our 10-player roster -- and one go-to play
content: We picked nine NFL players -- and one college football star -- for the U.S. Olympic flag football roster for 2028. Who would make our team?

title: Ranking the top 25 college football recruits regardless of class
content: Why let rising seniors get all the glory? We break down the best prospects in the country, including underclassmen.

title: How five-star prospects Jason Crowe, JaShawn Andrews﻿ fit at Mizzou, Arkansas
content: Breaking down the fits of every top class of 2026 commitment, beginning with No. 4 Jason Crowe and No. 12 JJ Andrews﻿

title: Updated top 10 prospect rankings for all 30 MLB teams -- with 2025 draft picks included!
content: Who is rising and falling in every major league farm system after the MLB draft? Kiley McDaniel digs in.

title: 'Sad.' 'Embarrassing.' Why players were a no-show at the MLB draft
content: Moving the draft to All-Star week was supposed to give it some sizzle. But not one player was in attendance.

title: Week 8 preview: Key stats, players for Indigenous Weekend
content: Fairfield, Connecticut, is the host for Friday's and Saturday's games. Here's the schedule, key stats, injury notes, more.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Forest want to sign Sancho from Man United
content: Nottingham Forest are preparing an audacious bid to sign Jadon Sancho from Manchester United. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Waiver wire: Start the second half strong with these pickups
content: As the season's second half gets ready to begin, here are the players you should claim off the waiver wire.

title: 'Rudy' or 'Hoosiers'? Indiana fan poll highlights SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 4 quiz
content: "SportsCenter" is continuing its journey across America -- and we're continuing to test your state-specific sports knowledge with our Week 4 quiz.

title: Electrocuted or murdered? Wife, brother-in-law held for Delhi jeweller’s death; cops probe affair angle
content: Delhi Police have launched a murder investigation into the death of Karan Dev, initially believed to be accidental electrocution. Suspicion arose after inconsistencies were found in the wife's statements and forensic evidence. Dev's brother raised concerns, prompting a deeper inquiry. The wife and brother-in-law have been apprehended and are being questioned.

title: Uttarkashi helicopter crash: AAIB report says pilot tried emergency landing
content: A preliminary report by the AAIB reveals that a helicopter crash near Gangnani, Uttarakhand, on May 8, 2025, resulted in six fatalities. The BELL 407 helicopter, operated by Aerotrans Services, crashed while attempting an emergency landing after descending from its assigned altitude. The main rotor struck a fiber cable, leading to the accident that killed five pilgrims and the pilot.

title: Jasprit Bumrah's replacement for 4th Test revealed
content: Veteran Indian cricketer Ajinkya Rahane has suggested that left-arm pacer Arshdeep Singh should step in if Jasprit Bumrah is rested. Arshdeep, who has picked up 99 wickets in 63 T20Is, is still awaiting his Test debut. However, his participation in Manchester has been thrown into doubt due to an injury suffered during a practice session.

title: Flow control? China starts mega-dam project on Brahmaputra in Tibet
content: China has commenced construction of a major dam on the Brahmaputra River in Tibet, near the Indian border, with Premier Li Qiang present at the groundbreaking. The massive hydropower project, aimed at boosting China's carbon neutrality and regional development, raises concerns in India and Bangladesh regarding potential impacts on water flow and the river's ecology.

title: Google's ex-CEO Eric Schmidt says America is ill-equipped to address AI's 'biggest challenge'
content: Eric Schmidt warns that a looming energy shortage threatens the AI revolution, with electricity becoming the primary constraint, not chips or funding. The US faces a 92-gigawatt shortfall to support AI, prompting tech giants to seek new power sources like nuclear energy. As AI development accelerates, concerns rise about its environmental impact and the need for proactive energy planning.

title: Money mess! Pakistan Cricket Board forced to keep redundant coach Mahmood - details inside
content: The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) is in a bind with Azhar Mahmood's contract, facing a hefty compensation fee for early termination. Mike Hesson's appointment of his own staff further complicated matters, leaving the PCB struggling to justify Mahmood's salary. Despite Mahmood's interest in working with the junior team, internal opposition persists, leading to his interim appointment as Test head coach.

title: AI171 crash: US agency calls western media reports 'speculative'
content: Following Western media reports blaming the AI 171 captain for the June 12 crash, the NTSB has called these reports premature and speculative, supporting the ongoing investigation by India's AAIB. The AAIB has criticized the irresponsible drawing of conclusions through selective reporting.

title: New video of Astronomer CEO Andy Byron and HR head Kristin Cabot at Coldplay concert surfaces
content: A new video has emerged showing Astronomer CEO Andy Byron and HR head Kristin Cabot kissing at a Coldplay concert, preceding the 'Kiss Cam' incident. This footage intensifies the ongoing controversy, leading Astronomer to place both executives on leave and appoint Pete DeJoy as interim CEO.

title: AIIMS Patna: Odisha student found dead in hostel room; probe underway
content: A first-year MD student at AIIMS Patna, Yadvendra Shah, was discovered dead in his hostel room. Shah, originally from Odisha, was found after his room remained locked. His phone went unanswered, prompting authorities to investigate. Police are investigating the incident. A forensic team is assisting. Shah's family in Odisha has been notified. A postmortem examination will be conducted.

title: Perplexity CEO says Google ‘a giant bureaucratic organization’: ‘At some point, they need to…’
content: Perplexity's CEO, Aravind Srinivas, challenges Google's reliance on ads. He believes it hinders AI integration. Srinivas anticipates Google will adopt features from Perplexity's Comet browser. He also criticizes Google's organizational structure. Comet, an AI-powered browser, prioritizes users. It is currently available to premium Perplexity subscribers. A free version is planned. Srinivas aims to challenge Google's market dominance.

title: Why are Edlow and Vaughan calling OPT illegal? Here’s the real story
content: The U.S. Optional Practical Training (OPT) program, vital for international students seeking work authorization, faces challenges. Critics like Vaughan and Edlow argue OPT lacks congressional approval and facilitates exploitation, advocating for its termination or severe restriction. This move threatens the pipeline of global talent, particularly impacting Indian students and potentially reshaping America's dominance in tech and innovation.

title: Niti Aayog suggests easing rules for Chinese investment; 24% stake may be allowed
content: Niti Aayog has suggested a policy change that would allow Chinese entities to acquire up to 24% stake in Indian companies without needing additional security clearances. This proposal aims to ease investment processes, potentially boosting India's supply chain participation and exports.

title: Himanta vs Mamata: Assam & Bengal CMs trade barbs over identity politics, infiltration
content: A heated exchange erupted between Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma and West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee over identity politics and infiltration issues. Banerjee accused Assam's BJP government of targeting Bengali speakers, while Sarma claimed to combat unchecked Muslim infiltration causing demographic shifts. Sarma further accused Banerjee of prioritizing vote banks over national integrity by encouraging illegal encroachment in Bengal.

title: 'She is very talented': Melania Trump praises Taylor Swift
content: In a surprising turn of events in the summer of 2025, Melania Trump publicly praised Taylor Swift's talent during a visit to a children's hospital, despite Donald Trump's critical remarks. Simultaneously, Swift and Travis Kelce were spotted enjoying a low-key lunch date in Ohio, showcasing their genuine connection away from the spotlight.

title: Avalanche trade Rantanen for Necas; $10 M gamble faces test
content: The Colorado Avalanche's trade of Mikko Rantanen for Martin Nečas is under scrutiny as Nečas's contract talks intensify. GM Chris MacFarland gambled on Nečas's potential and cost control. Nečas's new deal will determine if the trade was a success, with comparisons to Rantanen's performance inevitable and impacting the Avalanche's future.

title: Brad Marchand called traitor before hostile Bruins homecoming
content: Hockey fans anticipate Brad Marchand's return to Boston's TD Garden on October 21. He was traded to Florida Panthers after sixteen seasons with the Bruins. Mike Rupp predicts a warm welcome for Marchand. Rupp expects Marchand's competitive spirit to surface. Analyst E.J. Hradek revealed Marchand wanted to stay in Boston. The Bruins aimed to rebuild.

title: IND vs ENG: 'What annoyed people was ...' - Shastri decodes Rahul's technical tweak
content: Former India head coach Ravi Shastri lauds opening batter KL Rahul's impressive form in the ongoing five-match Test series against England, attributing his success to a subtle technical adjustment in his stance. Ravi Shastri highlights that Rahul's front-foot tweak has unlocked consistency, enabling cleaner bat flow and minimising past vulnerabilities.

title: 'Engaged to each other?': Martin asks Indian couple after viral Coldplay kiss-cam moment
content: At a recent Coldplay concert in Boston, Chris Martin invited an Indian couple onstage after spotting their sign requesting to sing 'Magic' with him, creating a heartwarming moment.

title: Odisha shocker: Miscreants set 15-year-old girl on fire, in critical condition
content: In a shocking incident, a fifteen-year-old girl was attacked in Puri district. Three miscreants set her on fire. The victim is now in critical condition at AIIMS Bhubaneswar. Local residents helped her and took her to the hospital. Deputy Chief Minister Pravati Parida has assured full government support for her treatment.

title: Patna hospital murder: A gangster dies and an old ghost returns
content: The murder of Chandan Mishra in a Patna hospital exposed the deadly fallout between him and Onkarnath Singh alias Sheru, once partners in crime. Their alliance, forged in a juvenile home, terrorized Bihar's Shahabad region for a decade with extortion and murders.

title: Last time India played at Old Trafford, MS Dhoni produced masterclass
content: India faces England in the fourth Test at Old Trafford, trailing 2-1 in the series. In their last Test at the venue in 2014, India suffered a batting collapse, with only MS Dhoni's resilient 71 offering resistance. Shubman Gill's team aims for a turnaround to level the series and force a decider at The Oval.

title: 'Visited 42 countries, not Manipur': Kharge takes dig at PM Modi
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge criticized PM Modi and the BJP at a Mysuru event, questioning Modi's absence from Manipur amidst ongoing ethnic unrest. Kharge asserted that citizens would prevent any BJP/RSS attempts to alter the Constitution. He contrasted Congress's action-oriented approach with the BJP's rhetoric. Kharge also refuted claims of Karnataka's financial struggles, defending the Siddaramaiah government against BJP accusations.

title: After missing England tour and alimony battle, Shami back in action
content: Mohammed Shami, recovering from fitness concerns, has been named in Bengal's probables for the 2025-26 domestic season. After a stint with Sunrisers Hyderabad in the IPL 2025 and last playing for India in the 2025 Champions Trophy, he aims to return to competitive cricket. Shami's inclusion follows his recovery from ankle surgery and a notable performance in the Ranji Trophy.

title: Actor Sangeeta Bijlani’s farmhouse vandalised in Pune
content: Sangeeta Bijlani's farmhouse in Pune district was discovered vandalized after a long absence, prompting a police investigation. The property, located near Pawna Dam, showed signs of forced entry, with broken doors and window grills. Household items, including beds and a refrigerator, were damaged or destroyed, and a television set was reported missing, leading to the filing of a police complaint.

title: Watch: GOATs on the wall! Neymar showcases a look inside his living room
content: Neymar Jr.'s "hall of fame" jersey wall, featuring Ronaldo, Messi, Suárez, and himself, went viral, celebrating football legends. After a stint with Al-Hilal, Neymar returned to Santos, scoring a stunning winner against Flamengo. Despite fitness challenges, he extended his contract, aiming to represent Brazil at the 2026 World Cup, showcasing his enduring brilliance.

title: Watch: ‘Coldplay affair’ reaches MLB - viral moment recreated
content: The Coldplay kiss saga, involving a CEO and HR head, has reached a new level as the Phillie Phanatic hilariously re-enacted the viral moment during a Phillies game. This parody, referencing the alleged affair that led to an internal investigation, has ignited social media. The mascot's antics have drawn laughter and applause, further fueling the online meme frenzy.

title: Ticked off for holding hands, Haryana students return to thrash chemistry teacher
content: In Kaithal's Serhada village, students allegedly thrashed a chemistry teacher. This incident occurred after a disciplinary remark. Earlier, a similar attack happened in Hisar. The village panchayat and school staff protested, demanding action and security. The principal stated that the attack followed an advice to students regarding discipline. Police arrested Abhimanyu and Aman, aged 21 and 23.

title: 'Turned Bihar into Taliban': Tejashwi Yadav slams Nitish govt
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav has strongly criticized the Nitish Kumar-led NDA government in Bihar, citing a breakdown of law and order due to recent murders and violent incidents. He accused the BJP of turning Bihar into a "Taliban" and alleged government helplessness in curbing criminal activities.

title: UP horror: 4-year-old 'digitally raped' in Lucknow; accused arrested
content: In Lucknow, a four-year-old girl was allegedly 'digitally raped' by her school van driver, Mohd Arif, on July 14. The Indiranagar police arrested Arif, who also allegedly threatened the child’s family. The school manager, Sandeep Kumar, is named as a co-accused. The child's mother reported that the school ignored her complaints and attempted to suppress the incident.

title: Passenger beaten on train after complaining about food prices - watch
content: A disturbing video has surfaced showing pantry staff assaulting a passenger on the Veraval-Jabalpur Somnath Express after a complaint about overcharging. The incident, which occurred on July 15, 2025, prompted swift responses from Railway Seva and the Divisional Railway Manager of Jabalpur, including an apology and contract cancellation considerations.

title: Former Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro ordered to wear ankle monitor
content: Jair Bolsonaro, ex-president of Brazil, must wear an ankle monitor. The Supreme Court issued the order. Raids occurred at his home and party headquarters. He faces restrictions on movement and communication. Bolsonaro is accused of plotting to overturn the 2022 election. Donald Trump called it a witch hunt. He plans tariffs on Brazilian imports.

title: Luggage covered in poop? Virgin Atlantic says it did not come from plane
content: Virgin Atlantic refuted claims that passenger baggage arriving at JFK was soiled with human waste after social media posts went viral. The airline said it was not human poop and it did not come from the plane. The airline said the substance was grease from a broken pipe in the terminal.

title: 'Gives everything he has': Ex-cricketer lauds Siraj's impact, reveals stunning workload stat
content: Aakash Chopra has lauded Mohammed Siraj as a tireless asset for Indian cricket, particularly in Test matches. Chopra highlighted Siraj's significant workload, ranking him among the top three fast bowlers globally in terms of overs bowled since January 2023.

title: Shah Rukh Khan injured on 'King' sets: Shoot postponed
content: Shah Rukh Khan has reportedly sustained a muscular injury while filming an intense action sequence for his upcoming movie 'King' in Mumbai. Advised to rest for a month, the actor has flown to the United States for treatment, leading to the postponement of the film's shooting schedule from July-August to September-October.

title: What makes Kohli a genius? RCB analyst reveals secrets behind the legend's mind
content: Despite retiring from Test and T20I cricket, Virat Kohli's exceptional cricketing acumen continues to be lauded. Freddie Wilde, an RCB team analyst, highlighted Kohli's strategic brilliance, noting how his instincts often align with data analytics during team meetings. Kohli's ability to grasp nuances beyond data showcases his genius, complementing his remarkable ODI and IPL records.

title: Another scare: Air India Express flight from Hyderabad to Phuket makes U-turn mid-air
content: An Air India Express flight to Phuket returned to Hyderabad shortly after takeoff due to undisclosed reasons, adding to a series of recent technical issues across airlines. Earlier in the week, an IndiGo flight to Imphal also returned to Delhi due to a technical snag, undergoing checks before resuming its journey.

title: Patna hospital murder: 5 arrested in Kolkata over deadly shooting
content: In a joint operation, Patna Police and West Bengal STF apprehended five individuals in New Town, near Kolkata, concerning the murder of gangster Chandan Mishra. Mishra, a convicted murderer from Buxar, Bihar, was shot dead inside a Patna private hospital on Thursday while out on parole.

title: Eugenia Cooney death hoax: Influencer targeted by AI‑fueled rumor
content: A disturbing rumor about Eugenia Cooney's death spread rapidly online, fueled by a neighbor's claim of seeing a body bag removed from her home and a now-removed Meta AI confirmation. This, combined with her recent livestream collapse and subsequent social media silence, has ignited widespread concern among her fans and social media.

title: Report: Lakers eye $62M Hawks star to join LeBron‑Luka super duo
content: Los Angeles Lakers eye Atlanta Hawks' Onyeka Okongwu. This move follows Kristaps Porzingis's arrival in Atlanta. Okongwu's role might diminish. Lakers see a trade opportunity. He offers defense and rebounding. His contract is team-friendly. Lakers could offer draft picks and young players. Okongwu fits Lakers' championship goals. The team needs frontcourt help after trading Anthony Davis.

title: 'Is deshbhakti only for common people?': X users slam India legends for playing Pakistan in WCL
content: Former Indian cricketers, including Shikhar Dhawan and Yuvraj Singh, face backlash for participating in the World Championship of Legends alongside Pakistani players, despite heightened tensions following the Pahalgam attack. This decision has sparked criticism on social media, with users questioning the apparent contradiction between their public stance and participation in the private league.

title: Cash payments or UPI, GST to be collected: Tax department cautions Bengaluru vendors; here’s what it said
content: Karnataka's commercial taxes department clarifies GST rules for Bengaluru vendors. Small businesses must pay GST regardless of payment method. Notices were issued to those exceeding turnover limits via UPI. Traders should submit documents for verification. Officials are assisting with compliance and registration. The department aims to meet revenue targets amid financial pressures.

title: After decades, cultivation resumes in paddy fields of Chemmaruthy in Thiruvananthapuram
content: Uma variety of paddy sown on 59 acres under the ‘Tharishu-rahitha Chemmaruthy’ project. Besides the Panayara Pichakkasseri Padasekhara Samiti, National Service Scheme students of Palayamkunnu higher secondary school too are cultivating paddy

title: IISER Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala Police working on developing AI-driven crime monitoring and analysis tools
content: IISER Thiruvananthapuram has also entered into a memorandum of understanding with the Kerala government’s Additional Skill Acquisition Programme to develop skilled human resources in data science

title: India-EFTA trade pact to be implemented from October 1: Piyush Goyal
content: Under the pact, India has received an investment commitment of $100 billion in 15 years from the grouping while allowing several products, such as Swiss watches, chocolates, and cut and polished diamonds, at lower or zero duties

title: Odisha medical student found dead at AIIMS-Patna
content: A postgraduate student found dead in hostel room and body has been sent for the post-mortem examination

title: Hyderabad Water Board to construct 16,000 recharge pits in 90-days to augment groundwater resources
content: NGOs and organisations are tasked to identify suitable areas in Hyderabad for construction of recharge pits – injection wells, unused borewells, and rainwater harvesting pits

title: Knowledge key to the future, says Bharat Biotech Executive Chairman Krishna M. Ella
content: Degrees were conferred on 258 BS-MS, 76 MSc, 15 MS (Research), 26 PhD, and 15 Integrated PhD graduates at 13th convocation of the Indian Institute of Science Education and Research Thiruvananthapuram

title: CPI (M) opposes government’s move to allot RTC land to Lulu Group
content: The CPI (M) emphasized that instead of weakening the RTC, the government should be focusing on strengthening the public transport corporation by offering financial support and infrastructure development

title: Patna hospital murder: five police personnel suspended for dereliction of duty
content: “They have been suspended with immediate effect for dereliction of duty in connection with the murder of the convict inside a top private hospital on July 17,” Patna (Central) SP Diksha told

title: 2021 West Bengal post-poll violence case: Three police officers sent to jail for BJP worker’s murder
content: There were reports of unrest in many parts of the State after the 2021 Assembly elections; BJP worker Abhijit Sarkar was killed during this time

title: Kerala government sanctions ₹16.5 crore for upgrading seven schools in Alappuzha
content: A meeting in Thiruvananthapuram in the presence of P.P. Chitharanjan, MLA, also decides to restart stalled works on some other schools in the Alappuzha constituency

title: YSRCP slams Naidu’s ‘vindictive’ Governance; vows to fight back with renewed resolve
content: Former MLA Malladi Vishnu criticized the recent case filed against MP PV Mithun Reddy, calling it a “conspiracy” aimed at silencing voices from the opposition

title: INS Sandhayak visits Malaysian port to boost maritime, hydrographic cooperation
content: This visit demonstrates India's growing role in regional hydrographic capacity building under the Indian Naval Hydrographic Department (INHD) and National Hydrographic Office framework

title: Odisha girl set on fire: BJP witch-hunting Opposition instead of protecting daughters, claims TMC
content: “Where is your Beti Bachao slogan now? Where is @NCWIndia hiding? Or are they too busy witch-hunting opposition voices instead of protecting India’s daughters?” the TMC said in a post

title: Painless childbirth now a reality at Alappuzha MCH
content: 25 women have given birth without experiencing labour pain in the past three months at the hospital, thanks to epidural analgesia, which is available for less than ₹2,000 at the public health facility

title: Take up notice for impeaching Justice Yadav along with Justice Varma: John Brittas
content: CPI(M) leader calls for impeachment of Justice Varma and Yadav, emphasising the need to maintain judiciary integrity

title: BJP persecuting Bengali speakers in Assam claims Mamata Banerjee; Himanta Biswa Sarma hits back
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said the “divisive agenda of the BJP in Assam has crossed all limits and people of Assam will fight back”

title: AAP Punjab legislator from Kharar Anmol Gagan Maan resigns as MLA
content: The singer-turned-politician was elected from the Kharar assembly seat in the 2022 Punjab Assembly polls.

title: Degree colleges told to update programmes in line with new curriculum framework
content: Scrutiny of proposals would be done from July 25 to July 31 and provisional proceedings with conditional approvals by the APSCHE would be issued on August 1, Council Secretary said

title: ED action against Robert Vadra attempt to bring bad name to Gandhi family, Congress: Mallikarjun Kharge
content: Enforcement Directorate (ED) had filed a charge sheet against Robert Vadra, the businessman-husband of Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, in a money laundering case

title: MeT department issues red alert for heavy rainfall in parts of Uttarakhand's Kumaon region
content: Nainital, Champawat and Udham Singh Nagar in the Kumaon region are likely to be pounded by extremely heavy rainfall on Sunday

title: Kerala rains: IMD warns of heavy rainfall and gusty winds; red alert for five districts
content: Malappuram, Kozhikode, Wayanad, Kannur and Kasaragod are on red alert on Saturday, while Thrissur, Palakkad, Ernakulam and Idukki are on orange alert

title: Air India Express flight to Phuket returns to Hyderabad after technical issue
content: Airport officials confirmed that the return was prompted by a technical problem detected after take-off

title: Liquor Scam: MP Midhun Reddy appeared before SIT police
content: Rajampet MP was Accused No.4, and police arrested eleven accused in the multi-crore scam so far. Investigation officers seized the properties of some of the accused in the case

title: India a secular nation, minorities safest in this country, says Kiren Rijiju
content: Minority Affairs Minister said he has not come across a single case where a member of the minority community is willing to migrate out of India because of being deprived of anything in the country

title: Carcass of a fawn found at the foot of Tirumala hills
content: It is however not clear if it was killed by a leopard on the prowl or wild dogs moving in the vicinity

title: Congress’ street protest over statehood foiled by L-G administration in Srinagar
content: JKPCC president Tariq Hameed Karra described the police’s move to restrict and detain the party leaders from joining the protest march as “heavy-handed and undemocratic use of police power”.

title: Rahul using his constitutional position to protect family crimes: BJP
content: BJP leader Sudhanshu Trivedi accused the Congress's "first family" of seeking power and money even if it means dividing society in the name of region or language.

title: TTD suspends four employees for following ‘other faiths’
content: The employees did not follow the institution’s code of conduct and acted irresponsibly while performing their duties as employees representing and working in a Hindu religious organisation, the TTD management stated

title: No wrong in reaching compromise with Governor for students’ sake, says Kerala Minister V. Sivankutty
content: Sivankutty claims while Kerala government ‘wants all universities in the State to function properly, the same cannot be said of the Governor or some Vice Chancellors’

title: BRICS Media and Think Tank Forum calls for greater Global South role in shaping global AI governance
content: A major concern that emerged was the risks of AI capabilities being concentrated among a few actors located in a handful of countries, with several participants noting that it could create dangerous dependencies for Global South nations.

title: Private university student found dead in hostel room in Greater Noida; 2 employees arrested
content: The incident took place Friday (July 18, 2025) night, and a case has been filed at the Knowledge Park Police Station in Gautam Budh Nagar.

title: Rahul Gandhi should unite secular forces instead of creating divisions: John Brittas
content: John Brittas was reacting to the Rahul Gandhi's remarks in Kerala, where he equated the Communist Party of India (Marxist) with the RSS

title: SAD leader Majithia's judicial custody extended till August 2
content: Bikram Singh Majithia’s judicial custody has been extended till August 2. The SAD leader was brought from New Nabha Jail in Patiala for his appearance in the Mohali court.

title: MP seeks train from Mangaluru to Ayodhya, renaming of Bengaluru-Mangaluru-Kannur train after Rani Abbakka
content: In a letter to the Minister on July 18, Capt. Chowta said that demand for a direct train to Ayodhya from the people of coastal and Malnad regions of Karnataka is growing

title: Dubey's jibe at Raj Thackeray as their war of words continues
content: You come to Mumbai. 'Mumbai ke samandar me dubo dubo kar marengein'. (We will hammer you in the Mumbai sea), says MNS leader Raj Thackeray

title: Thackeray not just a brand, it is Maharashtra's identity, says Uddhav
content: Uddhav Thackeray has been accusing the BJP of trying to finish his party and has blamed it for engineering a split in the Shiv Sena in 2022

title: Lakshadweep administration mulls over acquiring Bitra island for defence purposes
content: A recent Government Notification outlined this proposal for the Department of Revenue to take over the entire land area of Bitra island

title: CBI arrests BSF employee on graft charge
content: Dharmender Kumar Verma, working in the Public Accounts Office, had demanded a bribe of ₹2 lakh to clear pending bills of the contractor

title: Don’t evict Cuddalore farmers until Revenue Secretary decides revision plea under Land Encroachment Act: Madras High Court
content: Justices M. Sundar and Hemant Chandangoudar order that even Revenue Secretary’s adverse decision should be kept in abeyance for 10 days to enable the farmers to seek further legal remedy

title: Actor Sangeeta Bijlani's farmhouse in Pune's Maval area vandalised, items stolen; cops begin probe
content: Theft reported at Sangeeta Bijlani’s farmhouse in Pune. The actor is shocked by the damage as valuables go missing

title: Ministry of Railways directs zones to issue standardised ID cards to vendors to curb illegal vending
content: Railway commercial officials said unauthorised vendors have become a real menace in trains and at stations as they sell adulterated food products that can cause serious health issues for passengers

title: ED summons Meta, Google officials in illegal betting case
content: According to sources, “Google and Meta platforms are promoting betting apps through advertisements and facilitating their reach to users”

title: Miscreants set 15-year-old girl on fire in Odisha, victim under treatment at AIIMS Bhubaneswar
content: Three miscreants set the girl on fire in Bayabar village while she was going to her friend’s house, eyewitnesses said

title: Stretch of NH-10 between Sikkim, Bengal closed for traffic after landslip
content: Clearance activities are underway on the stretch following landslides at Birik Dara in Kalimpong district of West Bengal

title: Arrest of former Chhattisgarh CM Baghel’s son Chaitanya is tactics to crush people’s voice, says Priyanka Gandhi
content: “Former Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel was about to raise the issue of forests in the Assembly. To stop him, ED raided his house and arrested his son,” Priyanka Gandhi said in a post

title: Police constable, three family members booked for dowry harassment in Madurai after audio describing abuse goes viral
content: The police constable and his father, who is an Inspector of Police in Virudhunagar district, have been suspended

title: India, U.S. teams conclude fifth round of talks for proposed trade pact: Official
content: India is seeking the removal of this additional tariff (26%), and is also seeking the easing of tariffs on steel and aluminium (50%) and the auto (25%) sectors

title: Repairs on U.K. fighter jet grounded in Kerala completed, aircraft to fly out soon
content: Stealth aircraft manufactured by Lockheed Martin is expected to return to its base station in UK by early next week, subject to clearance from Ministry of External Affairs and Ministry of Defence

title: Bangladesh apprehends 34 Indian fishermen; high commission seeks their early return
content: The fishermen were apprehended on the intervening night of July 14 and 15 for venturing into Bangladesh’s territorial waters

title: Five held from Bengal's New Town over Patna hospital murder
content: The accused were apprehended from a housing complex in the satellite township of the metropolis following raids conducted jointly by the Patna Police and West Bengal STF in the early hours of Saturday

title: 4 killed, 2 injured as car crashes into concrete barrier on bridge, catches fire in Chhattisgarh
content: The official said that the car rammed into a concrete barrier on the side of a small bridge and caught fire

title: Free coaching for competitive examinations for 300 candidates at Davanagere
content: Sankalpa Free Coaching Centre has been set up jointly by Davangere district administration, Davangere University, S.S. Care Trust and IAS Baba Coaching Centre

title: Waive ₹13,300 cr. dues for CRPF deployment for anti-Maoist operations in Jharkhand: Soren to Shah
content: ‘If the State is forced to pay such a huge amount, it will adversely impact development schemes in Jharkhand, Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren said in a letter to Union Home Minister Amit Shah.

title: Supreme Court questions Maharashtra over exclusive MCOCA courts, sets deadline for 2017 corporator murder case
content: The bench, which asked the trial court to hear the case twice in a month, directed the defence counsels to cooperate with the trial court and not seek unnecessary adjournments

title: Woman dies after being pushed in front of oncoming train at Diva railway station; man arrested
content: "We are checking CCTV footage and speaking with eyewitnesses to piece together the full sequence of events," the official added

title: Thirteen police personnel injured in road accident in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar
content: They were all taken to Muzaffarnagar Medical College. Driver Munnilal had a fracture in his leg, while others got minor injuries

title: Uttar Pradesh records 18 deaths in 24 hours due to excessive rainfall
content: According to a statement, six people died in Chitrakoot district, while 3 each were killed in Mahoba, Banda and Moradabad. One each died in Ghazipur, Lalitpur and Gonda.

title: Fresh batch of over 6,000 pilgrims embark on Amarnath Yatra from Jammu
content: Annual Amarnath Yatra begins with tight security, separate convoys to Nunwan-Pahalgam and Baltal, attracting over 2.75 lakh pilgrims

title: ED files chargesheet against Uttarakhand Congress leader Harak Singh Rawat, wife in PMLA case
content: The accused named in the chargesheet include Harak Singh Rawat, his wife Deepti Rawat, his alleged associate Birendra Singh Kandari, Laxmi Singh Rana and the Smt. Poorna Devi Memorial Trust.

title: Mu. Ka. Muthu, Karunanidhi’s eldest son, is no more
content: Mr. Muthu was born to Karunanidhi’s first wife Padmavathi; he was an actor and singer, who was known to have styled himself after MGR

title: Jammu and Kashmir: Budha Amarnath Yatra to begin on July 28
content: Emphasising safety, the IGP stressed strict adherence to convoy timings and urged public awareness for travelling only with the official convoy

title: Heartbreaking scenes at Kochi airport as mother of Midhun who was electrocuted at school returns from Kuwait
content: Suja reportedly left for Kuwait as domestic help of an Arab family just four months ago to help her family recover from huge debts

title: 'Trump missile' fired 24th time, PM must make statement in Parliament: Congress
content: Trump stated that if India and Pakistan want a trade agreement with the U.S., they have to agree to an immediate ceasefire, Jairam Ramesh pointed out.

title: Pakistan claims terror network 'dismantled', denies LeT link to Pahalgam attack
content: Stating that the investigation into the Pahalgam attack is “still inconclusive,” Pakistan’s Foreign Office said, “any linkage with LeT, a defunct organisation banned in Pakistan, belies ground realities”.

title: National Sports Governance Bill historic, will usher in new era for India, says Kiren Rijiju
content: The Bill seeks to create a framework for good governance in the National Sports Federations (NSFs) and the Indian Olympic Association (IOA)

title: Maharashtra excise department lapses caused revenue loss of several crore rupees: CAG
content: The cumulative effect of these lapses caused a massive revenue loss for the government, raising serious concerns about the functioning of the Excise Department, the CAG stated

title: Police searches underway at 10 locations in Kashmir
content: The CIK searches are being conducted in six locations in Ganderbal, two in Budgam, and one each in Pulwama and Srinagar

title: A.P. BJP president to begin State-wide tour from July 26
content: During his visits, Mr. Madhav would interact with the BJP cadre, apart from creating awareness on the development programmes being undertaken by the NDA government.

title: Girijana Aikya Vedika opposes inclusion of Boyas, Valmikis in ST list
content: The Boyas and Valmikis do not satisfy these criteria in the current socio-economic context of Andhra Pradesh, says Girijana Aikya Vedika State working president

title: NIA chargesheets top CPI (Maoist) leader for waging war against India
content: The supplementary chargesheet was filed before the NIA Special Court in Hyderabad, naming C.P. Moideen alias Girish, under various provisions of the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act, 1967, and the Indian Penal Code (IPC).

title: He changed colours like chameleon: Shinde lambasts Uddhav Thackeray
content: The Shiv Sena leader revealed that Devendra Fadnavis made "40-50 calls" after the alliance of the undivided Shiv Sena and BJP retained its majority in the 2019 assembly elections, but Uddhav Thackeray did not respond

title: INDIA bloc parties to hold key online meet on July 19 to discuss prevailing political situation
content: The TMC, which was earlier said to be skipping the INDIA bloc meeting, however, said its national general secretary Abhishek Banerjee will attend the online meeting.

title: Himanta Sarma vs Mamata Banerjee On Mother Tongue And Demographics
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee today launched a fresh attack on Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma, claiming the BJP-led Assam government is threatening citizens who want to coexist by respecting all languages.

title: MP Claims 190 Andhra Cops Without Postings Or Pay For A Year, State Denies
content: In a strongly-worded letter sent to the Prime Minister and others, an MP from Andhra Pradesh has called for urgent intervention into what he termed the "unconstitutional" and "inhuman" treatment of over 190 police officers.

title: Coldplay “Canoodlers” Game Created After Viral Kiss Cam Moment Exposes Astronaut CEO-HR Chief Affair
content: What began as an awkward moment during a Coldplay concert has now inspired a quirky point-and-click game. And, it is making the rounds online.

title: 'Neha', Living In India For 10 Years, Turns Out To Be Bangladeshi Man Abdul
content: In a startling revelation that could potentially expose an organised racket of illegal immigration and identity fraud, Bhopal Police has detained a Bangladeshi national, Abdul Kalam, who had been living in the city for the past eight years.

title: Red Alert In 5 Kerala Districts As Heavy Rains Batter Northern Region
content: The IMD on Saturday issued a 'red alert' for five northern districts of Kerala, where incessant rains lashed several towns and high-range areas, causing inundation and traffic snarls.

title: Boy, 13, Sexually Assaulted On Indore School Campus, 2 Teens Detained: Cops
content: Two teenagers, aged 16 and 17, have been detained for allegedly sexually assaulting a 13-year-old boy on the premises of a school in Indore, police officials said here on Saturday.

title: Hyderabad-Phuket Air India Express Flight Returns Due To Technical Issue
content: An Air India Express flight IX 110 from Hyderabad to Phuket on Saturday was diverted back to Hyderabad shortly after departure due to technical issue.

title: 'Show Proof They Carried Out Pahalgam Attack': Pak Deputy PM Ishaq Dar Openly Supports TRF
content: During a speech at the Pakistani Parliament, Foreign Minister Ishaq Dar openly defended The Resistance Front (TRF). On 18th July, the United States designated TRF as a Foreign Terrorist Organisation.

title: Hidden In Comic Books, Cocaine Worth Rs 40 Crore Seized At Bengaluru Airport
content: Four kilograms of cocaine hidden inside superhero comic books, worth Rs 40 crore, were seized at the Bengaluru International Airport on Saturday, leading to the arrest of one passenger.

title: Release Of 'Udaipur Files' Will Leave Many Shaken: Rajasthan Minister To NDTV
content: Rajasthan Minister Jogaram Patel issued a warning regarding the upcoming film Udaipur Files, which is based on the 2022 murder of Udaipur-based tailor Kanhaiya Lal.

title: Over 20 Injured As Vehicle Drives Into Crowd In Los Angeles' East Hollywood
content: The Los Angeles Fire Department reported that avehicle drove into crowd in Los Angeles' East Hollywood leaving more than 20 injured.

title: Tripura Sets Up Task Force To Deport Infiltrators From Bangladesh
content: Amid a row over the issue, a 15-member special task force has been constituted by the West Tripura district to detect, identify and deport illegal immigrants, including Rohingyas, from Bangladesh and Myanmar.

title: All 5 Accused, Who Killed Gangster In Bihar Hospital, Arrested
content: The accused were arrested from a housing complex in the satellite township of the metropolis following raids conducted jointly by the Bihar Police and its West Bengal counterpart.

title: "Let Us Live In Peace": Revanth Reddy To Andhra Over Irrigation Projects
content: Revanth Reddy underscored the vital importance of projects such as the Palamuru-Rangareddy Lift Irrigation Scheme, along with Dindi, Kalwakurthy, Bheema, Nettempadu, and Koilsagar for Telangana's development.

title: India Will Ink Trade Deals Only If They Are In Nation's Interest: Piyush Goyal
content: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal on Saturday said that India will enter international trade agreements only if they serve the country's interests.

title: "Can't Get Mouth Open": Delhi Woman To Lover Midway Through Husband's Murder
content: A 36-year-old man's death in Delhi's Uttam Nagar, initially attributed to accidental electrocution, has turned into a murder case following the discovery of a chat between his wife and cousin.

title: Tirupati Board Suspends 4 Non-Hindu Employees For Flouting Code Of Conduct
content: The Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) has suspended four of its employees following allegations that they were practicing a non-Hindu faith, which is reportedly in violation of the institution's code of conduct.

title: Software Engineer Detained Over E-Mails Threatening To Blow Up Golden Temple
content: A software engineer was rounded up from Faridabad in connection with the five e-mails sent to the Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee (SGPC) threatening to blow up the Golden Temple, officials said on Friday.

title: Sharda University Student Kills Self Over 'Staff Harassment', Varsity Reacts
content: A second-year Bachelor of Dental Surgery student of Sharda University in Greater Noida allegedly died by suicide in the women's hostel, alleging humiliation and mental harassment by two faculty members, police said on Saturday.

title: 4-Year-Old Girl Sexually Assaulted In School Van In UP, Driver Arrested
content: Uttar Pradesh Police arrested a school van driver for allegedly sexually assaulting a four year old girl student. The accused has been identified as Mohd Arif.

title: Second half sees Ceddanne Rafaela at second base?
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . a mild 71 degrees with wind blowing slightly in could help keep a pair of potent lineups in check . the only game in jeopardy is the Washington Nationals hosting the San Diego Padres .

title: Sights and sounds from the second round of the 2025 Open Championship
content: the second round of the 153rd Open Championship has ended at Royal Portrush Golf Course in northern Ireland . Scottie Scheffler takes control of the proceedings with a 7-under performance Friday, bringing a 10-under into the weekend . pic.twitter.com/f33PdsVDmG Making his move .

title: Why Drake Maye can be a top-10 QB in 2025
content: in 11 starts from Week 6 to Week 17, Drake Maye threw for 2,254 yards, 15 touchdowns and 10 interceptions . that translated to an average of 16.0 fantasy points per game in those starts, which would have ranked just outside the top 12 quarterbacks over a full season . Maye has all the makings of a top-10 fantasy quarterback .

title: How to approach potential Rashee Rice suspension
content: fantasy football buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around the NFL . fantasy managers should brace for the likelihood Rice will miss a noticeable portion of the 2025 season . the odds of him serving a multigame suspension have significantly increased .

title: What we're hearing in the transfer window: Sancho, Rashford headed to Juve?
content: the transfer window is open across Europe, and business is starting to get done . sportsmail's reporters hear about possible deals every Friday until September . it's highly unlikely that Juventus will get both players, for a number of reasons .

title: Our latest intel on MLB trade deadline rumors, Tucker's free agency and more
content: the baseball world gathered in Atlanta for the 2025 MLB draft , home run Derby and all-star game this week . our reporters were there talking to execs, coaches, agents, scouts, players and other team sources .

title: If the College Football Playoff isn't broken, why fix it?
content: college football's opposition to an expanded, let alone expansive, playoff is dead and buried . the 81-year-old retired just this week after a second stint leading west Virginia University . plans to move from 12 participants to 16 were underway before last season's inaugural 12-teamer even took place .

title: Dear 'Diamond': Letters to Dustin Poirier on the eve of his final UFC fight
content: Dustin Poirier will make his final walk to the UFC Octagon against Max Holloway . the 36-year-old says he has decided to walk away to preserve his long-term health . poirier is considered one of the top lightweights in the world, ranked no. 5 in ESPN's divisional rankings .
